text: Portofino Lighthouse () is an active lighthouse located in Portofino, Metropolitan City of Genoa, Liguria, northern Italy, on the western extremity of the peninsula in the Gulf of Tigullio. ==Description== The lighthouse was built in 1917 and consists of a white quadrangular tower, high, with balcony and lantern, attached to a 2-storey white keeper's house. The lantern, painted in grey metallic, is positioned at above sea level and emits one white flash in a 5 seconds period, visible up to a distance of . The lighthouse is completely automated, powered by a solar unit and is operated by the Marina Militare with the identification code number 1675 E.F. ==See also== * List of lighthouses in Italy * Portofino ==References== ==External links== * Servizio Fari Marina Militare Category:Lighthouses in Italy
